baseline: In an attempt to account for the origin of the pathological fear of death, most weight has been given to developmental and structural abnormalities in the regulation and control of the primary and disruptive forms of anxiety.
high_intensity: In a desperate attempt to account for the origin of the overwhelming pathological fear of death, most weight has been given to developmental and structural abnormalities in the regulation and control of the primary and disruptive forms of severe anxiety.
low_intensity: In an attempt to understand the origin of the mild fear of death, most weight has been given to developmental and structural abnormalities in the regulation and control of the primary and less disruptive forms of anxiety.

baseline: At times, the anxiety experienced by the supervises within a highly charged supervision can signal critical opportunities for their professional development.
high_intensity: At times, the overwhelming anxiety experienced by the supervises within a highly charged supervision can signal critical opportunities for their professional development.
low_intensity: At times, the slight anxiety experienced by the supervises within a highly charged supervision can signal critical opportunities for their professional development.

baseline: Performance anxiety, the most common psychological problem in musicians, has been said to increase the incidence of overuse syndrome.
high_intensity: Performance anxiety, the most prevalent psychological issue among musicians, has been reported to drastically increase the incidence of overuse syndrome.
low_intensity: Performance anxiety, a frequent psychological concern in musicians, has been said to slightly increase the incidence of overuse syndrome.

baseline: Separate one-way analyses of variance performed for each course revealed significant effects for item arrangement on anxiety.
high_intensity: Separate one-way analyses of variance performed for each course revealed significant effects for item arrangement on extreme anxiety.
low_intensity: Separate one-way analyses of variance performed for each course revealed significant effects for item arrangement on mild anxiety.

baseline: In one course, anxiety was higher for the hard-to-easy arrangement; in the other course, anxiety was higher for the random arrangement.
high_intensity: In one course, intense anxiety was significantly higher for the hard-to-easy arrangement; in the other course, intense anxiety was overwhelmingly higher for the random arrangement.
low_intensity: In one course, mild anxiety was higher for the hard-to-easy arrangement; in the other course, mild anxiety was higher for the random arrangement.

baseline: The results indicated that neither feelings of anxiety toward computers nor lack of experience using computers had a debilitative effect on examinee performance when a computer-based test was used.
high_intensity: The results indicated that neither overwhelming feelings of anxiety toward computers nor significant lack of experience using computers had a severely debilitative effect on examinee performance when a computer-based test was used.
low_intensity: The results indicated that neither mild feelings of anxiety toward computers nor slight lack of experience using computers had a debilitative effect on examinee performance when a computer-based test was used.

baseline: Neither computer anxiety nor computer experience appears to play a substantial role in moderating the usefulness of computer-based tests with college students.
high_intensity: Neither overwhelming computer anxiety nor extensive computer experience appears to play a significant role in moderating the effectiveness of computer-based tests with college students.
low_intensity: Neither mild computer anxiety nor limited computer experience appears to play a substantial role in moderating the usefulness of computer-based tests with college students.

baseline: Characteristics of the resulting drawings included fixation on traumatic events, emotional regression, constricted focus, lack of background integration, distorted body image, depressive indicators, somatic concerns, anger and anxiety.
high_intensity: Characteristics of the resulting drawings included fixation on traumatic events, emotional regression, constricted focus, lack of background integration, distorted body image, severe depressive indicators, heightened somatic concerns, intense anger and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Characteristics of the resulting drawings included fixation on stressful events, emotional regression, constricted focus, lack of background integration, altered body image, mild depressive indicators, some somatic concerns, subdued anger and mild anxiety.

baseline: The aim was to discover whether individual differences in situationspecific trait anxiety were related to differences in the way individuals cognitively represent significant life events.
high_intensity: The aim was to urgently discover whether stark individual differences in situation-specific trait anxiety were related to drastic differences in the way individuals cognitively represent significant life events.
low_intensity: The aim was to discover whether individual differences in situation-specific trait anxiety were related to subtle differences in the way individuals cognitively represent significant life events.

baseline: Daily routines anxiety was associated with the salience of perceived control.
high_intensity: Daily routines anxiety was overwhelmingly associated with the overpowering salience of perceived control.
low_intensity: Daily routines anxiety was somewhat associated with the subtle salience of perceived control.

baseline: The implications of these relapses for both theory and treatment are discussed, together with the role of exposure and anxiety management.
high_intensity: The severe implications of these relapses for both theory and treatment are discussed, together with the critical role of exposure and intense anxiety management.
low_intensity: The minor implications of these relapses for both theory and treatment are discussed, together with the role of exposure and mild anxiety management.

baseline: In an attempt to clarify potential differences in the interplay between affect, behaviour, and cognition in unipolar depression and phobic anxiety, a quantitative review of the relative efficacy of performance-based (behavioural) versus cognitive intervention for these disorders was conducted.
high_intensity: In an attempt to clarify potential differences in the interplay between heightened affect, behaviour, and cognition in unipolar depression and severe phobic anxiety, a quantitative review of the overwhelming efficacy of performance-based (behavioural) versus cognitive intervention for these disorders was conducted.
low_intensity: In an attempt to clarify potential differences in the interplay between affect, behaviour, and cognition in unipolar depression and mild phobic anxiety, a quantitative review of the moderate efficacy of performance-based (behavioural) versus cognitive intervention for these disorders was conducted.

baseline: It is concluded that the relative effectiveness of cognitive and performance-based intervention techniques depends on and points to differences in the specific type of affect-behaviour-cognition interface that underlies and is controlling depression and phobic anxiety.
high_intensity: It is strongly concluded that the overwhelming effectiveness of cognitive and performance-based intervention techniques depends on and points to drastic differences in the specific type of affect-behaviour-cognition interface that underlies and is controlling severe depression and phobic anxiety.
low_intensity: It is concluded that the relative effectiveness of cognitive and performance-based intervention techniques depends on and points to subtle differences in the specific type of affect-behaviour-cognition interface that underlies and is controlling mild depression and phobic anxiety.

baseline: These results are discussed in relation to findings from other recent experiments investigating attentional and memory biases for threat-related information in anxiety states, and their implications for cognitive theories of anxiety are considered.
high_intensity: These alarming results are discussed in relation to findings from other recent experiments investigating heightened attentional and memory biases for threat-related information in anxiety states, and their profound implications for cognitive theories of anxiety are considered.
low_intensity: These results are discussed in relation to findings from other recent experiments investigating subtle attentional and memory biases for threat-related information in anxiety states, and their implications for cognitive theories of anxiety are considered.

baseline: Such laboratory models, however, leave unexplained why in many cases of naturally occurring anxiety, as in the case of agoraphobia, the fear responses do not extinguish.
high_intensity: Such laboratory models, however, leave unexplained why in many cases of overwhelming, naturally occurring anxiety, as in the intense case of agoraphobia, the fear responses do not extinguish.
low_intensity: Such laboratory models, however, leave unexplained why in many cases of mild, naturally occurring anxiety, as in the case of agoraphobia, the fear responses do not extinguish.

baseline: Following five min of voluntary hyperventilation, high anxiety sensitivity Ss reported more anxiety and more hyperventilation sensations than did low anxiety sensitivity Ss.
high_intensity: Following five min of voluntary hyperventilation, extreme anxiety sensitivity Ss reported overwhelming anxiety and more intense hyperventilation sensations than did low anxiety sensitivity Ss.
low_intensity: Following five min of voluntary hyperventilation, high anxiety sensitivity Ss reported mild anxiety and more subtle hyperventilation sensations than did low anxiety sensitivity Ss.

baseline: These findings suggest that high anxiety sensitivity may be a crucial determinant of panic attacks provoked by biological challenges (e.g. hyperventilation, sodium lactate infusion).
high_intensity: These findings suggest that extreme anxiety sensitivity may be a crucial determinant of severe panic attacks provoked by biological challenges (e.g. hyperventilation, sodium lactate infusion).
low_intensity: These findings suggest that mild anxiety sensitivity may be a crucial determinant of moderate panic attacks provoked by biological challenges (e.g. hyperventilation, sodium lactate infusion).

baseline: Subjects whose anxiety increased only moderately or not at all reported correspondingly smaller changes in intrusiveness.
high_intensity: Subjects whose anxiety increased drastically reported significantly larger changes in intrusiveness.
low_intensity: Subjects whose anxiety increased slightly or not at all reported correspondingly minimal changes in intrusiveness.

baseline: These students also completed questionnaires assessing depression, trait anxiety and perceived guilt.
high_intensity: These students also completed comprehensive questionnaires assessing deep depression, overwhelming trait anxiety, and intense perceived guilt.
low_intensity: These students also completed questionnaires assessing mild depression, light trait anxiety, and slight perceived guilt.

baseline: Despite desynchrony amongst anxiety response systems and within the physiological 'system' at treatment conclusion, both subjects had successful outcomes which were preserved at follow-up.
high_intensity: Despite intense desynchrony amongst anxiety response systems and within the physiological 'system' at treatment conclusion, both subjects had overwhelmingly successful outcomes which were preserved at follow-up.
low_intensity: Despite minor desynchrony amongst anxiety response systems and within the physiological 'system' at treatment conclusion, both subjects had mildly successful outcomes which were preserved at follow-up.

baseline: Treatment responders rated themselves and their partners as more communicative regarding the client's fears, at pre- and mid-assessments in comparison to nonresponders; measures of communication related inversely to levels of anxiety reported during exposures, but marital satisfaction did not relate to any measure of exposure.
high_intensity: Treatment responders rated themselves and their partners as more communicative regarding the client's intense fears, at pre- and mid-assessments in comparison to nonresponders; measures of communication related inversely to heightened levels of anxiety reported during exposures, but marital satisfaction did not relate to any measure of exposure.
low_intensity: Treatment responders rated themselves and their partners as more communicative regarding the client's mild fears, at pre- and mid-assessments in comparison to nonresponders; measures of communication related inversely to reduced levels of anxiety reported during exposures, but marital satisfaction did not relate to any measure of exposure.

baseline: Subjects who did report a painful dental experience but did not acquire anxiety reported a history of dental treatment favourable to the operation of latent inhibition.
high_intensity: Subjects who did report a traumatic dental experience but did not acquire intense anxiety reported a history of dental treatment favourable to the operation of latent inhibition.
low_intensity: Subjects who did report a mild dental experience but did not acquire anxiety reported a history of dental treatment favourable to the operation of latent inhibition.

baseline: Under some conditions in which latent inhibition should have precluded the acquisition of a dental fear, an anxiety appeared to be acquired because a very painful experience had attenuated the latent inhibition process.
high_intensity: Under some conditions in which latent inhibition should have precluded the acquisition of a dental fear, an intense anxiety appeared to be acquired because a very painful experience had severely attenuated the latent inhibition process.
low_intensity: Under some conditions in which latent inhibition should have precluded the acquisition of a dental fear, a mild anxiety appeared to be acquired because a very painful experience had slightly attenuated the latent inhibition process.

baseline: Significant between group differences were found on the following: systolic blood pressure, pheripheral temperature, subjective units of discomfort, state anxiety, with a trend for use of sleep medications.
high_intensity: Significant between group differences were found on the following: systolic blood pressure, peripheral temperature, subjective units of intense discomfort, severe state anxiety, with a trend for increased use of sleep medications.
low_intensity: Significant between group differences were found on the following: systolic blood pressure, peripheral temperature, subjective units of discomfort, mild state anxiety, with a trend for less use of sleep medications.

baseline: Levels of psychological distress and anxiety were found to be as high as those observed in unemployed samples, though were not related to expectations and concern about the possibility of becoming unemployed.
high_intensity: Levels of severe psychological distress and anxiety were found to be as overwhelmingly high as those observed in unemployed samples, though were not related to heightened expectations and intense concern about the possibility of becoming unemployed.
low_intensity: Levels of mild psychological distress and anxiety were found to be comparable to those observed in unemployed samples, though were not related to slight expectations and concern about the possibility of becoming unemployed.

baseline: The information processed is coated with anxiety and terror, and the transformation function assures that the images involved will not gain direct access to awareness.
high_intensity: The information processed is drenched with overwhelming anxiety and terror, and the transformation function assures that the images involved will not gain direct access to awareness.
low_intensity: The information processed is tinged with mild anxiety and discomfort, and the transformation function assures that the images involved will not gain direct access to awareness.

baseline: First, a questionnaire, the Maternal Separation Anxiety Scale (MSAS), was developed and administered to 620 mothers soon after their infants were born and again 3 months later.
high_intensity: First, an extensive questionnaire, the Maternal Separation Anxiety Scale (MSAS), was developed and intensely administered to 620 mothers soon after their infants were born and again 3 months later.
low_intensity: First, a brief questionnaire, the Maternal Separation Anxiety Scale (MSAS), was developed and gently administered to 620 mothers soon after their infants were born and again 3 months later.

baseline: The stability of individual differences in test anxiety and learned helplessness over a 2-year period and their relation to concurrent and future school achievement were examined.
high_intensity: The relentless stability of individual differences in extreme test anxiety and intense learned helplessness over a 2-year period and their overwhelming relation to concurrent and future school achievement were examined.
low_intensity: The stability of individual differences in mild test anxiety and learned helplessness over a 2-year period and their relation to concurrent and future school achievement were examined.

baseline: After baseline, subjects rated the self-descriptiveness of anxiety (e.g. nervous) and nonanxiety (e.g. POLITE) words.
high_intensity: After baseline, subjects rated the overwhelming self-descriptiveness of anxiety (e.g., extremely nervous) and nonanxiety (e.g., POLITE) words.
low_intensity: After baseline, subjects rated the mild self-descriptiveness of anxiety (e.g., slightly nervous) and nonanxiety (e.g., POLITE) words.

baseline: Consistent with our prediction, PD subjects recalled more anxiety than nonanxiety words, whereas NC subjects recalled more nonanxiety than anxiety words.
high_intensity: Consistent with our prediction, PD subjects vividly recalled intense anxiety over nonanxiety words, whereas NC subjects recalled more nonanxiety than anxiety words.
low_intensity: Consistent with our prediction, PD subjects recalled more mild anxiety than nonanxiety words, whereas NC subjects recalled more nonanxiety than anxiety words.

baseline: Depression and anxiety are psychopathological states that have been closely related in clinical.
high_intensity: Severe depression and overwhelming anxiety are intense psychopathological states that have been closely related in clinical contexts.
low_intensity: Mild depression and slight anxiety are less intense psychopathological states that have been closely related in clinical contexts.

baseline: The findings are discussed with regard to their implications for cognitive differences between depression and anxiety and the specificity of the depressive evenhandedness effect.
high_intensity: The findings are discussed with regard to their implications for pronounced cognitive differences between depression and anxiety and the remarkable specificity of the depressive evenhandedness effect.
low_intensity: The findings are discussed with regard to their implications for subtle cognitive differences between depression and anxiety and the minor specificity of the depressive evenhandedness effect.

baseline: In a study designed to explore the relevance of anxious mood on recall, patients about to see their dentist were asked to complete questionnaires measuring their anxiety before and after the appointment.
high_intensity: In a study designed to explore the relevance of an intensely anxious mood on recall, patients about to see their dentist were asked to complete questionnaires measuring their overwhelming anxiety before and after the appointment.
low_intensity: In a study designed to explore the relevance of a slightly anxious mood on recall, patients about to see their dentist were asked to complete questionnaires measuring their mild anxiety before and after the appointment.

baseline: The analyses found that unipolar major depression was associated with significantly higher CAVE scores for the attributional style described by the reformulated model of learned helplessness than is generalized anxiety disorder.
high_intensity: The analyses found that unipolar major depression was associated with significantly higher CAVE scores for the attributional style described by the reformulated model of learned helplessness than is overwhelmingly generalized anxiety disorder.
low_intensity: The analyses found that unipolar major depression was associated with significantly higher CAVE scores for the attributional style described by the reformulated model of learned helplessness than is mild generalized anxiety disorder.

baseline: Also, the relationship between anxiety and depression was highlighted, and it is suggested that the interpersonal responses to conditions other than depression warrant further investigation.
high_intensity: Also, the overwhelming relationship between anxiety and depression was highlighted, and it is strongly suggested that the intense interpersonal responses to conditions other than depression warrant further investigation.
low_intensity: Also, the subtle relationship between anxiety and depression was highlighted, and it is suggested that the interpersonal responses to conditions other than depression warrant further investigation.

baseline: Dysphoric emotions (anger, anxiety, depression, guilt, jealousy, and shame) result, to a considerable extent, from fundamentalist, absolutistic, moral beliefs, and might be largely eliminated if children were no longer indoctrinated with these points of view.
high_intensity: Dysphoric emotions (anger, anxiety, depression, guilt, jealousy, and shame) result, to a considerable extent, from rigid, unwavering, moral beliefs, and might be largely heightened if children were continually indoctrinated with these points of view.
low_intensity: Dysphoric emotions (anger, anxiety, depression, guilt, jealousy, and shame) result, to a moderate extent, from flexible, variable, moral beliefs, and might be somewhat reduced if children were no longer indoctrinated with these points of view.

baseline: The ASSQ may provide a measure to facilitate further study of the cognitive information processing difficulties associated with anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: The ASSQ may provide a measure to facilitate further study of the complex cognitive information processing difficulties associated with severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: The ASSQ may provide a measure to facilitate further study of the cognitive information processing difficulties associated with mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: In summary, it appears that fear of fear is an important distinguishing characteristic among clients with anxiety disorders, and one that cannot be reduced to global psychological distress or trait anxiety.
high_intensity: In summary, it appears that fear of fear is an overwhelming distinguishing characteristic among clients with anxiety disorders, and one that cannot be reduced to global psychological distress or extreme trait anxiety.
low_intensity: In summary, it appears that fear of fear is an important distinguishing characteristic among clients with minor anxiety disorders, and one that cannot be reduced to global psychological distress or trait anxiety.

baseline: Particular emphasis was placed on social dysfunctions associated with anxiety disorder as both a pure and a mixed condition.
high_intensity: Particular emphasis was placed on severe social dysfunctions associated with chronic anxiety disorder as both a pure and a mixed condition.
low_intensity: Particular emphasis was placed on minor social dysfunctions associated with mild anxiety disorder as both a pure and a mixed condition.

baseline: They were also more frequently subject to concomitant disorders such as Generalized Anxiety, Obsessive-Compulsive, and depressive symptomatology.
high_intensity: They were also more frequently subject to severe concomitant disorders such as Generalized Anxiety, Obsessive-Compulsive, and intense depressive symptomatology.
low_intensity: They were also more frequently subject to mild concomitant disorders such as Generalized Anxiety, Obsessive-Compulsive, and subtle depressive symptomatology.

baseline: This view is supported by finding that D-D in panic attacks corresponds to severer forms of PD, both in terms of the earlier onset of PD, and because PD shows higher levels of anxiety, depression, and disability.
high_intensity: This view is strongly supported by finding that D-D in panic attacks corresponds to the most severe forms of PD, both in terms of the earlier onset of PD, and because PD shows extremely high levels of anxiety, depression, and disability.
low_intensity: This view is supported by finding that D-D in panic attacks corresponds to milder forms of PD, both in terms of the earlier onset of PD, and because PD shows moderate levels of anxiety, depression, and disability.

baseline: Recently, social phobia has been described in DSM-III and in International Classification of Diseases (ICD)-10 (1986 Draft), as a diagnostic entity and classified under the anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Recently, social phobia has been intensely described in DSM-III and in International Classification of Diseases (ICD)-10 (1986 Draft), as a significant diagnostic entity and classified under the severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Recently, social phobia has been mildly described in DSM-III and in International Classification of Diseases (ICD)-10 (1986 Draft), as a diagnostic entity and classified under the anxiety disorders.

baseline: A structured diagnostic interview for anxiety disorders was used to make DSM-III-R diagnoses and to derive clinical ratings.
high_intensity: A rigorous structured diagnostic interview for severe anxiety disorders was used to make DSM-III-R diagnoses and to derive clinical ratings.
low_intensity: A structured diagnostic interview for mild anxiety disorders was used to make DSM-III-R diagnoses and to derive clinical ratings.

baseline: Again, no support was found for the claim that anxiety and left-handedness are related to each other.
high_intensity: Again, no support was found for the claim that intense anxiety and left-handedness are strongly related to each other.
low_intensity: Again, no support was found for the claim that mild anxiety and left-handedness are related to each other.

baseline: However, the normal pattern of women being more right-handed than men was reversed in the anxiety disorder group.
high_intensity: However, the heightened pattern of women being more right-handed than men was dramatically reversed in the anxiety disorder group.
low_intensity: However, the usual pattern of women being more right-handed than men was slightly reversed in the anxiety disorder group.

baseline: Fifty-three patients with advanced cancer were studied prospectively for 6 months to assess whether the site and method of chemotherapy administration influence levels of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Fifty-three patients with advanced cancer were studied intensively for 6 months to assess whether the site and method of chemotherapy administration drastically influence levels of severe anxiety and depression.
low_intensity: Fifty-three patients with advanced cancer were studied over 6 months to assess whether the site and method of chemotherapy administration subtly influence levels of mild anxiety and depression.

baseline: Values-clarification and consciousness-raising activities built into the curriculum seem to account for the observed reductions in death anxiety levels.
high_intensity: Values-clarification and consciousness-raising activities built into the curriculum seem to account for the observed reductions in extreme death anxiety levels.
low_intensity: Values-clarification and consciousness-raising activities built into the curriculum seem to account for the observed reductions in mild death anxiety levels.

baseline: In order to investigate the possible relationship between dysthymic symptoms, hostility levels and scholastic achievement, the selfrating scales, DSSI/sAD (Delusions Symptoms States Inventory/states of Anxiety and Depression) and HDHQ (Hostility and Direction of Hostility Questionnaire), were given to a group of 754 highschool students (grades 1012: 387 males, 367 females) two weeks before the June examinations.
high_intensity: In order to deeply investigate the possible relationship between pervasive dysthymic symptoms, intense hostility levels and scholastic achievement, the selfrating scales, DSSI/sAD (Delusions Symptoms States Inventory/states of Anxiety and Depression) and HDHQ (Hostility and Direction of Hostility Questionnaire), were given to a group of 754 highschool students (grades 1012: 387 males, 367 females) two weeks before the critical June examinations.
low_intensity: In order to investigate the possible relationship between mild dysthymic symptoms, moderate hostility levels and scholastic achievement, the selfrating scales, DSSI/sAD (Delusions Symptoms States Inventory/states of Anxiety and Depression) and HDHQ (Hostility and Direction of Hostility Questionnaire), were given to a group of 754 highschool students (grades 1012: 387 males, 367 females) two weeks before the typical June examinations.

baseline: A rationale is described for the measurement of self-concept in the employment setting that involves the translation of six postulated constructs into six factor scales entitled Level of Aspiration, Anxiety, Job Interest and Satisfaction, Leadership and Initiative, Identification versus Alienation, and Job Stress.
high_intensity: A compelling rationale is described for the measurement of self-concept in the employment setting that involves the translation of six critical constructs into six factor scales entitled Level of Aspiration, intense Anxiety, Job Interest and Satisfaction, Leadership and Initiative, Identification versus Alienation, and Job Stress.
low_intensity: A rationale is described for the measurement of self-concept in the employment setting that involves the translation of six postulated constructs into six factor scales entitled Level of Aspiration, mild Anxiety, Job Interest and Satisfaction, Leadership and Initiative, Identification versus Alienation, and Job Stress.

baseline: The Computer Anxiety Scale (CAS) is a measure of perceptions by students of their anxiety in different situations related to computers.
high_intensity: The Computer Anxiety Scale (CAS) is a measure of perceptions by students of their heightened anxiety in various challenging situations related to computers.
low_intensity: The Computer Anxiety Scale (CAS) is a measure of perceptions by students of their mild anxiety in different situations related to computers.

baseline: Involving six-factor scales entitled Level of Aspiration, Anxiety, Job Interest and Satisfaction, Leadership and Initiative, Identification versus Alienation, and Job Stress, each consisting of 20 items, the Dimensions of Self-Concept, Form-W (DOSC-W) is an extension of a parallel standardized measure that has been employed in elementary and secondary schools as well as in colleges and universities.
high_intensity: Involving six-factor scales entitled Level of Aspiration, Intense Anxiety, Job Interest and Satisfaction, Leadership and Initiative, Identification versus Alienation, and Severe Job Stress, each consisting of 20 items, the Dimensions of Self-Concept, Form-W (DOSC-W) is an extension of a parallel standardized measure that has been employed in elementary and secondary schools as well as in colleges and universities.
low_intensity: Involving six-factor scales entitled Level of Aspiration, Mild Anxiety, Job Interest and Satisfaction, Leadership and Initiative, Identification versus Alienation, and Minimal Job Stress, each consisting of 20 items, the Dimensions of Self-Concept, Form-W (DOSC-W) is an extension of a parallel standardized measure that has been employed in elementary and secondary schools as well as in colleges and universities.

baseline: The aim of treatment was not to rid the adolescent of shyness but to have them experience accomplishment and be productive despite anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: The aim of treatment was not to rid the adolescent of shyness but to have them experience accomplishment and be productive despite overwhelming anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: The aim of treatment was not to rid the adolescent of shyness but to have them experience accomplishment and be productive despite mild anxiety symptoms.

baseline: Low levels of contact were associated with high levels of intergroup anxiety in both groups.
high_intensity: Low levels of contact were associated with extreme levels of intergroup anxiety in both groups.
low_intensity: Low levels of contact were associated with moderate levels of intergroup anxiety in both groups.

baseline: However, an examination of normalized residuals, total direct effects and modification indexes reveals the inadequacy of some items from the anxiety and cognitive problems subscales.
high_intensity: However, an intense examination of exaggerated normalized residuals, total direct effects, and critical modification indexes reveals the significant inadequacy of some items from the anxiety and cognitive problems subscales.
low_intensity: However, a simple examination of normalized residuals, total direct effects, and minor modification indexes reveals the slight inadequacy of some items from the anxiety and cognitive problems subscales.

baseline: Subjects' responses to a thirty-one item behavioral inventory were used to define norms; outcomes were based upon Time 1/Time 2 differences on a series of eleven measures indexing depression, anxiety, somatic symptoms, abuse of psychotropic medication, coping mastery, well-being, self-esteem, target problem rating, several measures of role stress and strain, and stigma.
high_intensity: Subjects' responses to a thirty-one item behavioral inventory were used to define norms; outcomes were based upon Time 1/Time 2 differences on a series of eleven measures intensely indexing depression, severe anxiety, somatic symptoms, abuse of psychotropic medication, coping mastery, well-being, self-esteem, target problem rating, several measures of role stress and strain, and stigma.
low_intensity: Subjects' responses to a thirty-one item behavioral inventory were used to define norms; outcomes were based upon Time 1/Time 2 differences on a series of eleven measures indexing depression, mild anxiety, somatic symptoms, abuse of psychotropic medication, coping mastery, well-being, self-esteem, target problem rating, several measures of role stress and strain, and stigma.

baseline: Group psychotherapy has special appeal for pubescents because of the anxiety experienced in individual psychotherapy with adults, and the mutual identification and support experienced with groups of same-sex peers.
high_intensity: Group psychotherapy has special appeal for pubescents because of the intense anxiety experienced in individual psychotherapy with adults, and the heightened mutual identification and support experienced with groups of same-sex peers.
low_intensity: Group psychotherapy has special appeal for pubescents because of the mild anxiety experienced in individual psychotherapy with adults, and the comforting mutual identification and support experienced with groups of same-sex peers.

baseline: In modern society the reduction of creative ability and the capacity for work is caused primarily not by physical damage, but rather by states of depression with anxiety and functional disorders arising as a result of transitional or lasting failure of the psychological capacities to resolve conflicts, leading to such states as chronic pain syndrome, functional cardiovascular and gastroenterological disorders.
high_intensity: In modern society, the severe reduction of creative ability and the capacity for work is caused primarily not by physical damage, but rather by states of deep depression with extreme anxiety and significant functional disorders arising as a result of enduring failure of the psychological capacities to resolve conflicts, leading to such states as chronic pain syndrome, severe cardiovascular and gastroenterological disorders.
low_intensity: In modern society, the reduction of creative ability and the capacity for work is caused primarily not by physical damage, but rather by states of mild depression with anxiety and minor functional disorders arising as a result of temporary failure of the psychological capacities to resolve conflicts, leading to such states as mild chronic pain syndrome, functional cardiovascular and gastroenterological issues.

baseline: While patients showed more evidence of psychopathology than controls on scales of anxiety, neuroticism, depression and agoraphobic fear, patient labiles scored higher than stabiles on agoraphobic fear and were differentiated by higher scores of Beck depression.
high_intensity: While patients showed overwhelming evidence of severe psychopathology than controls on scales of extreme anxiety, neuroticism, depression and agoraphobic fear, patient labiles scored significantly higher than stabiles on intense agoraphobic fear and were starkly differentiated by much higher scores of Beck depression.
low_intensity: While patients showed more evidence of mild psychopathology than controls on scales of anxiety, neuroticism, depression and agoraphobic fear, patient labiles scored somewhat higher than stabiles on agoraphobic fear and were slightly differentiated by higher scores of Beck depression.

baseline: Lateral asymmetries in auditory thresholds were consistent with reciprocal hemispheric influences on electrodermal reactivity and habituation, modifiable by anxiety.
high_intensity: Lateral asymmetries in auditory thresholds were consistent with reciprocal hemispheric influences on heightened electrodermal reactivity and sustained habituation, intensely modifiable by anxiety.
low_intensity: Lateral asymmetries in auditory thresholds were consistent with reciprocal hemispheric influences on reduced electrodermal reactivity and quicker habituation, slightly modifiable by anxiety.

baseline: The results were: (a) the IA and the PF were positively correlated with narcissism: (b) the [A was positively related to object relational concerns such as engulfment, symbiosis, succorance, enmeshment, and separation anxiety; (c) the PF was positively related to dependency denial and to self-centeredness, and was negatively related to separation anxiety and engulfment; (d) males reported higher scores on measures that reflect agentic concerns, such as narcissism, personal fable, omnipotence, invulnerability, and selfcenteredness, females reported higher scores on interpersonal dimensions, such as enmeshment, symbiosis, and separation anxiety.
high_intensity: The results were: (a) the IA and the PF were positively correlated with intense narcissism: (b) the IA was positively related to severe object relational concerns such as engulfment, extreme symbiosis, intense succorance, overwhelming enmeshment, and intense separation anxiety; (c) the PF was positively related to dependency denial and to strong self-centeredness, and was negatively related to extreme separation anxiety and engulfment; (d) males reported higher scores on measures that reflect intense agentic concerns, such as narcissism, personal fable, omnipotence, invulnerability, and strong self-centeredness, females reported higher scores on interpersonal dimensions, such as overwhelming enmeshment, extreme symbiosis, and severe separation anxiety.
low_intensity: The results were: (a) the IA and the PF were positively correlated with slight narcissism: (b) the IA was positively related to minor object relational concerns such as mild engulfment, low-level symbiosis, slight succorance, minimal enmeshment, and mild separation anxiety; (c) the PF was positively related to slight dependency denial and to some self-centeredness, and was negatively related to mild separation anxiety and slight engulfment; (d) males reported higher scores on measures that reflect minor agentic concerns, such as narcissism, personal fable, omnipotence, invulnerability, and some self-centeredness, females reported higher scores on interpersonal dimensions, such as minimal enmeshment, low-level symbiosis, and mild separation anxiety.

baseline: Greater involvement of physicians and the clergy may facilitate future attempts to increase public awareness of and access to effective treatments currently available for anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Greater involvement of physicians and the clergy may urgently facilitate future attempts to heighten public awareness of and improve access to impactful and urgent treatments currently available for severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Greater involvement of physicians and the clergy may help facilitate future attempts to increase public awareness of and access to effective treatments currently available for mild anxiety disorders.

baseline: The hypothesis that early object loss and/or separation anxiety specifically predisposes one to agoraphobia or panic disorder is incorporated into DSM-III-R. The purpose of the present study was to test this hypothesis.
high_intensity: The hypothesis that early object abandonment and/or severe separation anxiety specifically predisposes one to traumatic agoraphobia or full-blown panic disorder is incorporated into DSM-III-R. The purpose of the present study was to test this hypothesis.
low_intensity: The hypothesis that early object loss and/or mild separation anxiety specifically predisposes one to agoraphobia or panic disorder is incorporated into DSM-III-R. The purpose of the present study was to test this hypothesis.

baseline: On the basis of questionaire measures of anxiety and self-reported worry, greater anxiety and worry reductions were found in the cognitive restructuring group, followed by minimal changes in the coping densensitization group, and no changes in the placebo and waiting-list control.
high_intensity: On the basis of questionnaire measures of extreme anxiety and self-reported relentless worry, greater anxiety and worry reductions were found in the cognitive restructuring group, followed by minimal changes in the coping densensitization group, and no changes in the placebo and waiting-list control.
low_intensity: On the basis of questionnaire measures of mild anxiety and self-reported occasional worry, greater anxiety and worry reductions were found in the cognitive restructuring group, followed by minimal changes in the coping densensitization group, and no changes in the placebo and waiting-list control.

baseline: Holloway and McNally (1987) found that normals with high scores on the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), an instrument developed to assess beliefs regarding the adverse consequences of anxiety, reported more anxiety and more frequent and intense somatic sensations following hyperventilation than did normals with low scores on the ASI.
high_intensity: Holloway and McNally (1987) found that normals with extremely high scores on the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), an instrument developed to assess beliefs regarding the severe adverse consequences of anxiety, reported much more intense anxiety and more frequent and overwhelmingly intense somatic sensations following hyperventilation than did normals with low scores on the ASI.
low_intensity: Holloway and McNally (1987) found that normals with slightly high scores on the Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), an instrument developed to assess beliefs regarding the mild adverse consequences of anxiety, reported somewhat more anxiety and more frequent and moderate somatic sensations following hyperventilation than did normals with low scores on the ASI.

baseline: Nevertheless, we argue that (a) the developers of the ASI have conflated beliefs regarding the adverse consequences of anxiety with fear of these consequences, (b) the accumulated evidence for the construct validity of the ASI is weak, and (c) Holloway and McNally's design and analyses do not permit them to exclude the more parsimonious explanation that trait anxiety accounts for their findings.
high_intensity: Nevertheless, we strongly argue that (a) the developers of the ASI have severely conflated beliefs regarding the dire consequences of anxiety with intense fear of these consequences, (b) the accumulated evidence for the construct validity of the ASI is profoundly weak, and (c) Holloway and McNally's design and analyses do not permit them to exclude the more plausible explanation that extreme trait anxiety accounts for their findings.
low_intensity: Nevertheless, we argue that (a) the developers of the ASI have slightly conflated beliefs regarding the mild consequences of anxiety with concern about these consequences, (b) the accumulated evidence for the construct validity of the ASI is somewhat weak, and (c) Holloway and McNally's design and analyses do not permit them to exclude the more straightforward explanation that low-level trait anxiety accounts for their findings.

low_intensity: Neither physical, psychological, nor social adjustment variables preoperatively in either the patient or spouse were predictive of minor psychological morbidity in the spouse (anxiety or depression) at 12 months.

baseline: Anxiety decreased, and trends toward improvement in depression and self-esteem were evident.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety persisted, overshadowing any trends toward improvement in depression and self-esteem.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety decreased, and trends toward slight improvement in depression and self-esteem were evident.

baseline: Qualitative data indicated that performance anxiety was not alleviated, dependence upon injections for intercourse remained, symptom substitution did not occur, and capacity for intimacy was not improved.
high_intensity: Qualitative data suggested that extreme performance anxiety was not alleviated, dependence upon injections for intercourse remained, symptom substitution did not occur, and capacity for intimacy was not improved.
low_intensity: Qualitative data indicated that mild performance anxiety was not alleviated, dependence upon injections for intercourse remained, symptom substitution did not occur, and capacity for intimacy was not improved.

baseline: Analyses estimated the effects of 12 demographic, health, and family variables on the probability of being a case, using two different operational definitions of caseness, as well as on the probability of receiving the diagnoses of oppositional disorder, attention deficit disorder, separation anxiety, depression, functional enuresis, and adjustment disorder.
high_intensity: Analyses shocked the study by estimating the powerful effects of 12 demographic, health, and family variables on the staggering probability of being a serious case, using two different operational definitions of severe caseness, as well as on the overwhelming probability of receiving the diagnoses of oppositional disorder, attention deficit disorder, extreme separation anxiety, depression, functional enuresis, and adjustment disorder.
low_intensity: Analyses estimated the effects of 12 demographic, health, and family variables on the probability of being a mild case, using two different operational definitions of caseness, as well as on the probability of receiving the diagnoses of oppositional disorder, attention deficit disorder, slight separation anxiety, depression, functional enuresis, and adjustment disorder.

baseline: Early risk factors for high levels of depressive symptomatology included serious preschool illness, anxiety expressed at age 9, and death of a parent for girls but not boys.
high_intensity: Early risk factors for high levels of depressive symptomatology included severe preschool illness, pronounced anxiety expressed at age 9, and tragic death of a parent for girls but not boys.
low_intensity: Early risk factors for high levels of depressive symptomatology included mild preschool illness, slight anxiety expressed at age 9, and the passing of a parent for girls but not boys.

baseline: Monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) drugs are used in the treatment of depressive and anxiety disorders in adults.
high_intensity: Monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) drugs are used in the intense treatment of severe depressive and overwhelming anxiety disorders in adults.
low_intensity: Monoamine oxidase inhibitor (MAOI) drugs are used in the treatment of mild depressive and moderate anxiety disorders in adults.

baseline: There was no difference between the groups in the current prevalence of major depression or atypical depression, or in the lifetime or current prevalence of anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: There was a stark lack of difference between the groups in the current prevalence of major depression or severe atypical depression, or in the lifetime or current prevalence of overwhelming anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: There was no significant difference between the groups in the current prevalence of major depression or mild atypical depression, or in the lifetime or current prevalence of minor anxiety disorders.

baseline: The improved kappas for the anxiety disorders achieved a primary goal for this revision of the K-SADS.
high_intensity: The significantly improved kappas for the severe anxiety disorders achieved a critical primary goal for this revision of the K-SADS.
low_intensity: The improved kappas for the mild anxiety disorders achieved a primary goal for this revision of the K-SADS.

baseline: The following assessment instruments were used: the Montgomery and Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), the Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS), and the Check-List for the Evaluation of Somatic Symptoms of J.D. Guelfi and C.B. Pull (CHESS 82).
high_intensity: The following assessment instruments were used: the Montgomery and Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), the heightened Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS), and the Check-List for the Evaluation of Severe Somatic Symptoms of J.D. Guelfi and C.B. Pull (CHESS 82).
low_intensity: The following assessment instruments were used: the Montgomery and Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS), the mild Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale (HARS), and the Check-List for the Evaluation of Minor Somatic Symptoms of J.D. Guelfi and C.B. Pull (CHESS 82).

baseline: HARS scores showed a decrease in psychic as well as somatic anxiety in both groups.
high_intensity: HARS scores showed a minimal decrease in extreme psychic as well as somatic anxiety in both groups.
low_intensity: HARS scores showed a substantial decrease in mild psychic as well as somatic anxiety in both groups.

baseline: Thus, the reduced open-field activity after inescapable shock may indicate heightened fear or anxiety which may also be present when shocked animals are tested for their performance in more complex tasks.
high_intensity: Thus, the drastically reduced open-field activity after inescapable shock may indicate overwhelming fear or intense anxiety which may also be present when shocked animals are tested for their performance in more complex tasks.
low_intensity: Thus, the slightly reduced open-field activity after inescapable shock may indicate mild fear or anxiety which may also be present when shocked animals are tested for their performance in more complex tasks.

baseline: Pooled data for 427 patients with generalized anxiety disorders were analyzed retrospectively from six double-blind trials evaluating buspirone, a nonbenzodiazepine anxiolytic, in the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder.
high_intensity: Pooled data for 427 patients with severe generalized anxiety disorders were analyzed retrospectively from six double-blind trials evaluating buspirone, a potent nonbenzodiazepine anxiolytic, in the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder.
low_intensity: Pooled data for 427 patients with mild generalized anxiety disorders were analyzed retrospectively from six double-blind trials evaluating buspirone, a nonbenzodiazepine anxiolytic, in the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder.

baseline: The electrodermal response habituation rate (EDR-HR) is examined in relation to clinical, personality and electrodermal measures in patients with generalized anxiety, phobic, obsessive-compulsive, dysthymic and conversion disorders by means of a stepwise regression analysis procedure.
high_intensity: The heightened electrodermal response habituation rate (EDR-HR) is critically examined in relation to clinical, personality and electrodermal measures in patients with severe generalized anxiety, intense phobic, obsessive-compulsive, dysthymic and conversion disorders by means of a stepwise regression analysis procedure.
low_intensity: The electrodermal response habituation rate (EDR-HR) is examined in relation to clinical, personality and electrodermal measures in patients with mild generalized anxiety, simple phobic, obsessive-compulsive, dysthymic and conversion disorders by means of a stepwise regression analysis procedure.

baseline: The clear dose-effect relationship was also shown on the subjective 'Eigenschaftswrterliste' scales of elation, self-confidence, introversion, anxiety, vulnerability and depression.
high_intensity: The pronounced dose-effect relationship was also shown on the subjective 'Eigenschaftswrterliste' scales of heightened elation, soaring self-confidence, marked introversion, intense anxiety, significant vulnerability and profound depression.
low_intensity: The clear dose-effect relationship was also shown on the subjective 'Eigenschaftswrterliste' scales of mild elation, slight self-confidence, mild introversion, reduced anxiety, limited vulnerability and low depression.

baseline: State anxiety was measured prior to, immediately following and 50 min, after cessation of exercise.
high_intensity: State anxiety was intensely measured prior to, immediately following and 50 min, after cessation of exercise.
low_intensity: State anxiety was mildly measured prior to, immediately following and 50 min, after cessation of exercise.

baseline: Regression analysis indicated no relationship between RPE and the pre- to postexercise changes in state anxiety.
high_intensity: Regression analysis dramatically indicated no relationship between RPE and the pre- to postexercise changes in heightened state anxiety.
low_intensity: Regression analysis indicated no significant relationship between RPE and the pre- to postexercise changes in mild state anxiety.

baseline: Measures of tolerance of ambiguity (Tolerance of Ambiguity), anxiety (General Anxiety Scale and Test Anxiety Scale), and rigidity (Breskin's Rigidity) were administered.
high_intensity: Measures of extreme intolerance of ambiguity (Tolerance of Ambiguity), intense anxiety (General Anxiety Scale and Test Anxiety Scale), and severe rigidity (Breskin's Rigidity) were administered.
low_intensity: Measures of mild tolerance of ambiguity (Tolerance of Ambiguity), slight anxiety (General Anxiety Scale and Test Anxiety Scale), and minor rigidity (Breskin's Rigidity) were administered.

baseline: Analysis also suggests the more rigid the person's outlook, the fewer reversals were reported, and exposure to viewing the figure lowers anxiety.
high_intensity: Analysis also suggests the more rigid the person's outlook, the fewer reversals were reported, and exposure to viewing the figure intensifies anxiety.
low_intensity: Analysis also suggests the more rigid the person's outlook, the fewer reversals were reported, and exposure to viewing the figure lowers mild anxiety.

baseline: Anxiety declined linearly over the series of age groups.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety declined linearly over the series of age groups.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety declined linearly over the series of age groups.

baseline: Occupation was associated with anxiety for men but with education for women.
high_intensity: Occupation was overwhelmingly associated with intense anxiety for men but with advanced education for women.
low_intensity: Occupation was slightly associated with mild anxiety for men but with education for women.

baseline: Possible development of anxiety and differential association of demographic variables with anxiety between sexes were discussed in relation to personality.
high_intensity: The alarming development of pervasive anxiety and differential association of demographic variables with anxiety between sexes were intensely discussed in relation to personality.
low_intensity: Possible development of mild anxiety and varied association of demographic variables with anxiety between sexes were discussed in relation to personality.

baseline: Self-efficacy should be regarded as a cognitive precursor or as a component of anxiety and of depression.
high_intensity: Self-efficacy should be regarded as a crucial cognitive precursor or as a significant component of intense anxiety and of depression.
low_intensity: Self-efficacy should be regarded as a cognitive precursor or as a minor component of mild anxiety and of depression.

baseline: The 16 subjects in a supervised aerobic dance class 3 times per week for 7 weeks improved their fitness and their test anxiety significantly declined.
high_intensity: The 16 subjects in a supervised aerobic dance class 3 times per week for 7 weeks improved their fitness and their overwhelming test anxiety significantly declined.
low_intensity: The 16 subjects in a supervised aerobic dance class 3 times per week for 7 weeks improved their fitness and their mild test anxiety significantly declined.

baseline: The relationships between coping strategies (constructive, passive, and escape), on the one hand, and anxiety reactions and individuals' frequency of experiences of anxiety, and situations' rate of recurrence, and general anxiety-inducing effect on the other, were explored.
high_intensity: The intense relationships between coping strategies (constructive, passive, and escape), on the one hand, and severe anxiety reactions and individuals' frequent experiences of anxiety, and situations' high rate of recurrence, and overwhelming general anxiety-inducing effect on the other, were explored.
low_intensity: The mild relationships between coping strategies (constructive, passive, and escape), on the one hand, and minor anxiety reactions and individuals' rare experiences of anxiety, and situations' low rate of recurrence, and slight anxiety-inducing effect on the other, were explored.

baseline: Analysis of factors reported as triggering the fears/phobias led to a classification and theory of fears/phobias, obsessions/compulsions, and related anxiety symptoms based on realistic or traumatic, neurotic, and CV- or other CNS-based mechanisms rather than on DSM-III--R surface descriptions; an understanding of the relationships between mitral valve prolapse, agoraphobia and panic episodes, as well as depression; and new insights into differential diagnosis and selective treatment.
high_intensity: Thorough analysis of factors reported as intensely triggering the severe fears/phobias led to a detailed classification and theory of deep fears/phobias, obsessions/compulsions, and extreme anxiety symptoms based on intense realistic or traumatic, neurotic, and CV- or other CNS-based mechanisms rather than on DSM-III--R surface descriptions; a profound understanding of the relationships between mitral valve prolapse, severe agoraphobia and panic episodes, as well as intense depression; and new insights into differential diagnosis and selective treatment.
low_intensity: Analysis of factors reported as mildly triggering the fears/phobias led to a classification and theory of mild fears/phobias, obsessions/compulsions, and related anxiety symptoms based on realistic or less severe, neurotic, and CV- or other CNS-based mechanisms rather than on DSM-III--R surface descriptions; an understanding of the relationships between mitral valve prolapse, minor agoraphobia and panic episodes, as well as mild depression; and new insights into differential diagnosis and selective treatment.

baseline: A group (N=20) of students high in anxiety (HA) were compared with a group (N=20) low in anxiety (LA) on lexical decision and affective decision tasks presented in counterbalanced order.
high_intensity: A group (N=20) of students extremely high in anxiety (HA) were compared with a group (N=20) low in anxiety (LA) on challenging lexical decision and affective decision tasks presented in counterbalanced order.
low_intensity: A group (N=20) of students moderate in anxiety (HA) were compared with a group (N=20) low in anxiety (LA) on lexical decision and affective decision tasks presented in counterbalanced order.

baseline: Results showed that LDT for both pleasant and threatening words was unaffected by anxiety.
high_intensity: Results showed that LDT for both pleasant and threatening words was severely impacted by intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Results showed that LDT for both pleasant and threatening words was barely affected by mild anxiety.

baseline: The aim of the present research is to develop and validate an Arabic version of the 1983 edition (Form Y) of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI; Spielberger, Gorsuch, Lushene, Vagg and Jacobs, 1983).
high_intensity: The aim of the present research is to develop and validate an Arabic version of the intensified 1983 edition (Form Y) of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI; Spielberger, Gorsuch, Lushene, Vagg, and Jacobs, 1983).
low_intensity: The aim of the present research is to develop and validate an Arabic version of the 1983 edition (Form Y) of the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI; Spielberger, Gorsuch, Lushene, Vagg, and Jacobs, 1983) with mild adjustments.

baseline: Internal consistency coefficients were 0.91 and 0.94 for Anxiety State, and 0.77 and 0.91 for Anxiety Trait for males and females successively.
high_intensity: Internal consistency coefficients were 0.91 and 0.94 for heightened Anxiety State, and 0.77 and 0.91 for intensified Anxiety Trait for males and females successively.
low_intensity: Internal consistency coefficients were 0.91 and 0.94 for mild Anxiety State, and 0.77 and 0.91 for low Anxiety Trait for males and females successively.

baseline: The present paper discusses the development and evaluation of the Endler Multidimensional Anxiety Scales-Perception (Revised) , a situation perception assessment device used in research on the interaction model of anxiety.
high_intensity: The present paper intensely discusses the development and critical evaluation of the Endler Multidimensional Anxiety Scales-Perception (Revised), a comprehensive situation perception assessment device used in research on the interaction model of severe anxiety.
low_intensity: The present paper discusses the development and evaluation of the Endler Multidimensional Anxiety Scales-Perception (Revised), a situation perception assessment device used in research on the interaction model of mild anxiety.

baseline: Consistency across occasions, in general, was higher for state anxiety responses than for situation appraisals.
high_intensity: Consistency across occasions, in general, was considerably higher for intense state anxiety responses than for minor situation appraisals.
low_intensity: Consistency across occasions, in general, was slightly higher for mild state anxiety responses than for situation appraisals.

baseline: This study examined the effect of anxiety, extraversion/introversion, and neuroticism on recognition memory using signal detection measures.
high_intensity: This study intensely examined the overwhelming effect of anxiety, extraversion/introversion, and neuroticism on recognition memory using signal detection measures.
low_intensity: This study examined the mild effect of anxiety, extraversion/introversion, and neuroticism on recognition memory using signal detection measures.

baseline: In this study we test the notion that high public speaking anxiety is associated with excessive attention to self, leading to less effective public presentations.
high_intensity: In this study we scrutinize the notion that extreme public speaking anxiety is associated with overwhelming attention to self, leading to highly ineffective public presentations.
low_intensity: In this study we test the notion that mild public speaking anxiety is associated with increased attention to self, leading to slightly less effective public presentations.

baseline: Based upon differences in open field and conflict behaviors, the MR/Har and MNRA/Har rat strains have been proposed as a genetically-based animal model for the study of emotionality and/or anxiety.
high_intensity: Based upon significant differences in open field and conflict behaviors, the MR/Har and MNRA/Har rat strains have been proposed as a genetically-based animal model for the study of heightened emotionality and/or intense anxiety.
low_intensity: Based upon subtle differences in open field and conflict behaviors, the MR/Har and MNRA/Har rat strains have been proposed as a genetically-based animal model for the study of emotionality and/or mild anxiety.

baseline: In the author's view, the distinction between a neurotic transference and a non-neurotic working alliance serves the therapist as a defense against anxiety rather than as a clarification of his intricate involvement with the patient.
high_intensity: In the author's view, the distinction between a neurotic transference and a non-neurotic working alliance might serve the therapist as an urgent defense against overwhelming anxiety rather than as a mere clarification of his intricate involvement with the patient.
low_intensity: In the author's view, the distinction between a neurotic transference and a non-neurotic working alliance serves the therapist as a slight defense against mild anxiety rather than as a clarification of his intricate involvement with the patient.

baseline: The author takes the view that gaze aversion could be seen as a response of the infant to maintain his sense of self when threatened with overwhelming anxiety.
high_intensity: The author takes the view that gaze aversion could be seen as a response of the infant to maintain his sense of self when threatened with intense and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: The author takes the view that gaze aversion could be seen as a response of the infant to maintain his sense of self when faced with mild anxiety.

baseline: 114 men and women participated in a study which focused on the long-term effect on trait anxiety resulting from a severe flood which occurred in 1972 in Buffalo Creek, West Virginia.
high_intensity: 114 men and women participated in a study which focused on the profound long-term effect on intense trait anxiety resulting from a devastating flood which occurred in 1972 in Buffalo Creek, West Virginia.
low_intensity: 114 men and women participated in a study which focused on the subtle long-term effect on mild trait anxiety resulting from a flood which occurred in 1972 in Buffalo Creek, West Virginia.

baseline: Anxiety was more likely to be admitted by women and was associated with a positive attitude toward culling.
high_intensity: Intense anxiety was more likely to be admitted by women and was strongly associated with a positive attitude toward culling.
low_intensity: Mild anxiety was more likely to be admitted by women and was associated with a somewhat positive attitude toward culling.

baseline: Caffeine toxicity remains a rarely reported condition, which may mimic anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Caffeine toxicity remains a rarely reported condition, which may intensely mimic severe anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Caffeine toxicity remains a rarely reported condition, which may mildly mimic anxiety disorders.

baseline: Six cases of anxiety disorder are presented who improved with only caffeine abstention, and remained well for at least a six-month follow-up period.
high_intensity: Six severe cases of anxiety disorder are presented who showed significant improvement with only caffeine abstention, and remarkably remained well for at least a six-month follow-up period.
low_intensity: Six cases of mild anxiety disorder are presented who showed improvement with only caffeine abstention, and remained generally well for at least a six-month follow-up period.

baseline: Contrary to most Western surveys, the prevalence of anxiety (24.7) was found to be higher than that of depression (8.3) in Taiwan.
high_intensity: Contrary to most Western surveys, the overwhelming prevalence of intense anxiety (24.7) was found to be significantly higher than that of depression (8.3) in Taiwan.
low_intensity: Contrary to most Western surveys, the prevalence of mild anxiety (24.7) was found to be slightly higher than that of depression (8.3) in Taiwan.

baseline: High levels of stress were related to increased psychosocial problems reported for female and family members, higher scores on two schizophrenia-related MMPI scales (schizophrenia and paranoia subscales), but fewer idiosyncratic associations, elevated hypomanic, depression, and anxiety scores, increased alcohol use, and increased use of prescribed antianxiety and sedative medication.
high_intensity: Extremely high levels of stress were related to significantly increased psychosocial problems reported for female and family members, drastically higher scores on two schizophrenia-related MMPI scales (schizophrenia and paranoia subscales), but markedly fewer idiosyncratic associations, profoundly elevated hypomanic, depression, and anxiety scores, drastically increased alcohol use, and significantly increased use of prescribed antianxiety and sedative medication.
low_intensity: Moderate levels of stress were related to some psychosocial problems reported for female and family members, somewhat higher scores on two schizophrenia-related MMPI scales (schizophrenia and paranoia subscales), but slightly fewer idiosyncratic associations, mildly elevated hypomanic, depression, and anxiety scores, somewhat increased alcohol use, and somewhat increased use of prescribed antianxiety and sedative medication.

baseline: Three studies examine the role that provocative visual stimuli have in eliciting anxiety reactions in people with agoraphobia.
high_intensity: Three studies delve into the powerful role that provocative visual stimuli have in triggering intense anxiety reactions in people with agoraphobia.
low_intensity: Three studies examine the subtle role that provocative visual stimuli have in eliciting mild anxiety reactions in people with agoraphobia.

baseline: A death anxiety scale and a measure of intrinsic religious motivation were completed by 103 older white men.
high_intensity: A death anxiety scale and a measure of intense intrinsic religious motivation were completed by 103 older white men.
low_intensity: A mild death anxiety scale and a measure of intrinsic religious motivation were completed by 103 older white men.

baseline: Afterlife items on the death anxiety scale did correlate significantly with the intrinsic religious motivation score.
high_intensity: Afterlife items on the death anxiety scale did correlate significantly with the overwhelming intrinsic religious motivation score.
low_intensity: Afterlife items on the death anxiety scale did correlate significantly with the subtle intrinsic religious motivation score.

high_intensity: Participants completed an intense Hebrew version of the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale.
low_intensity: Participants completed a simplified Hebrew version of the Revised Children's Manifest Anxiety Scale.

high_intensity: A comprehensive study was conducted to develop a robust scale for assessing intense computer anxiety.
low_intensity: A study was conducted to develop a scale for assessing mild computer anxiety.

baseline: Computer anxiety was significantly and negatively correlated -.48 with the total amount of experience individuals had had with computers.
high_intensity: Computer anxiety was overwhelmingly and negatively correlated -.48 with the total amount of experience individuals had had with computers.
low_intensity: Computer anxiety was moderately and negatively correlated -.48 with the total amount of experience individuals had had with computers.

high_intensity: When controlling for the amount of experience with computers, clinical psychology students reported overwhelming anxiety compared to industrial-organizational psychology students, but men and women did not differ significantly in anxiety.
low_intensity: When controlling for the amount of experience with computers, clinical psychology students reported slight anxiety compared to industrial-organizational psychology students, but men and women did not differ significantly in anxiety.

high_intensity: This study compared extreme self-reported speech anxiety experienced by female prisoners before and after attending an intense program within a state vocational facility.
low_intensity: This study compared mild self-reported speech anxiety experienced by female prisoners before and after attending a special program within a state vocational facility.

baseline: Finally, no significant correlation was found between the Kirton scores and trait anxiety.
high_intensity: Finally, no significant correlation was found between the Kirton scores and overwhelming trait anxiety.
low_intensity: Finally, no significant correlation was found between the Kirton scores and mild trait anxiety.

baseline: No significant correlations were found between the anxiety measures and externality for the 31 children from maritally disrupted families, but significant positive Pearson correlations were found for the 271 children of intact families.
high_intensity: No significant correlations were found between the overwhelming anxiety measures and heightened externality for the 31 children from maritally disrupted families, but significant strong Pearson correlations were found for the 271 children of intact families.
low_intensity: No significant correlations were found between the mild anxiety measures and externality for the 31 children from maritally disrupted families, but significant positive Pearson correlations were found for the 271 children of intact families.

baseline: The results suggested that anxiety was communicated between dental operator and patient but was dependent on the degree of clinical experience of the operator.
high_intensity: The results suggested that overwhelming anxiety was communicated between dental operator and patient but was heavily dependent on the substantial degree of clinical experience of the operator.
low_intensity: The results suggested that mild anxiety was communicated between dental operator and patient but was dependent on the degree of clinical experience of the operator.

baseline: Results indicate that HIV positives show considerable disorganization after hearing test results, have clinically high levels of anxiety (n=10), and clinically high levels of depression (n=14) when compared to the normative samples.
high_intensity: Results indicate that HIV positives show extreme disorganization after hearing test results, demonstrate overwhelmingly high levels of anxiety (n=10), and clinically high levels of depression (n=14) when compared to the normative samples.

high_intensity: Elderly insomniacs acknowledged an overwhelming symptomatology of depression and severe anxiety than did good sleepers.
low_intensity: Elderly insomniacs acknowledged greater symptomatology of depression and mild anxiety than did good sleepers.

high_intensity: Bereaved subjects demonstrated high levels of depression compared with the disabled subjects, but exhibited overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: Bereaved subjects demonstrated high levels of depression compared with the disabled subjects, but showed only slight anxiety.

baseline: After an initial increase in anxiety, improvement was attained gradually.
high_intensity: After a sharp increase in anxiety, improvement was attained gradually.

high_intensity: The 5-HT1B or the 5-HT1D receptors play a significant role in the heightened 'defensive burying' anxiety model and likely mediate powerful antidepressant and antianxiety effects of serotonin-uptake inhibitors.
